intro: Pentacme tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly pentacme, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and stems, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
